name: Depths of Their World (1/2)
description:
This piece (and its partner) were unsuccessful submissions for an art prize - the winners of which would be displayed on a pair of LED billboards on the corner of Flinders and Elizabeth streets in Melbourne, AU.

I conceived this piece as a somewhat surreal and abstract work that would inspire its viewers: i. to explore the ‘depths of their world’ – seeking out its potential with a quixotic mind; and ii. to find themselves and others in that same world.

I chose the figure of a swimmer / diver because I felt it would exhibit a sense of individual and primitive freedom, as well as a sense of aspirational determination. The swimmer navigates the atomic complexity of its surroundings – of which it is made up and in which it is reflected – in an endeavour tempered by an appreciation of its world.

1890x450

@microwave_cooks
